name: Requesting a paladin/WM/??? Build for all 3 classic campaigns
author: Vardalia

posts.author: Vardalia
posts.content: Hello everyone! I have recently discovered your nice community and id like to seek your wisdom since I am a noob. I want to replay all 3 classic campaigns plague--> SoU--> HotU in that order. I m interested in a holy warrior build with paladin/ weapon master / ??? ( Maybe CoT?), Human race and ideally having any form of enserric the sword as the final weapon! Got any suggestions for me? :)

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
First of all, Welcome!

Second of all, SoU is supposed to start at level 1.  If you play it with the hero from the OC (plague campaign), you will be way too powerful and SoU will be too easy and boring.  Instead, follow the OC with Mines of Twin Summit to get all the way to level 40, and follow SoU and HotU with Sands of Fate to get to level 40.

I need to go to bed, so I will make a build for you sometime later.

posts.author: Vardalia
posts.content: Thank you for your quick reply! Looking forward to hearing your suggestions!

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:

Welcome to the guild Vardalia!

It is all right if you are not a fan of spell casters.  You will have great fun from this game anyway. You will soon enough learn that the main use of the RDD class is for melee builds, not casters.
As for WM, there are two main uses. One is to leave it at 7 levels for ki critical and improved multiplier. The other one is to take WM as major class for a high AB bonus from epic superior weapon focus.

Valerfor wrote:Never understood that Holy Sword nerf myself, they basically made it useless in 1.69 patch.
What Holy Sword nerf??? What was it before and what is it now?

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
In Neverwinter Nights, The Holy Avenger dispelled magic with every strike (50% chance) at an opposite caster level equal to the experience level of the Character.
After 1.69 Patch, it has a default caster level of 10.
It seems many people have problems to understand what a properly balanced "fix" is, going from full force to basically useless in one go.

Carsomyr & Pale Justice (BG II & IWD, respectively) have the even more powerful AD&D Holy Avenger properties, which, not only dispel magic at the experience level of the Paladin (and that should be the correct application of the rule, Paladin level & not Character level) but also gave them a default 50% magic resistance!
